intro: Craterocapsa congesta, commonly known as the clustered star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, cylindrical seed capsules. Craterocapsa congesta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
